Workflow.WorkStageName:
The function of this screen is to **verify whether an index rate code already exists** before registration.
① The system performs an **inquiry transaction** to check for any existing records matching the specified index rate code.
② If the code is found, the user is notified, preventing duplicate registrations.
③ If no matching record exists, the user can proceed with the registration process.
Does base interest rate code you want to register already exist?

The function of this screen is to **register and manage index rate codes** used in financial operations.
① Users can **create new index rate codes** by entering relevant details such as rate type, validity period, and associated financial instruments.
② The system **validates the input data** to ensure compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements.
③ Once registered, the index rate codes **can be referenced** in various financial transactions and reporting processes.

The function of this screen is to **verify whether registered or modified items have been applied correctly** by performing an **inquiry transaction**.
① Users can initiate an inquiry to retrieve details of the registered or updated data.
② The system retrieves and displays the latest status of the specified items.
③ If discrepancies are found, users can take corrective actions accordingly.
Are there any changes to be made?

The function of this screen is to **modify index rate codes** in the system.
① Switch to **edit mode** to update the existing index rate codes.
② Make the necessary modifications, such as adjusting rate values or descriptions.
③ Save the changes to apply them to the system.
Do you want to **delete the base interest rate code**?

The function of this screen is to **modify the status of a benchmark interest rate for deletion**.
① **Switch to Modify Mode** to enable changes.
② **Update the Status field to** `"DELETE"`, indicating that the benchmark interest rate is marked for removal.
**Head Office Base Interest Rate Linkage** (Updated **three times per day** based on Korea Standard Time: **07:30, 21:30, and 22:30**)

The function of this screen is to **retrieve and verify interfaced index rates** from **KUPID or MUREX** and **register the daily index rate**.
① **Check the interfaced index rates** from KUPID or MUREX.
② **Verify accuracy** to ensure there are no discrepancies.
③ **Apply the confirmed index rates** if they are correct.
④ **Register the final index rates** for the current day.

The function of this screen is to **switch to Inquiry mode** and **verify the proper registration of index rates**.
① **Access the Inquiry mode** to review the recorded index rates.
② **Check if the index rates have been successfully registered** in the system.
③ **Ensure accuracy and completeness** of the registered data before proceeding with further operations.
Activity costs linkage

The function of this screen is to **retrieve and display activity costs** associated with various business operations.
① Users can **input specific criteria** such as date range, cost category, or department to filter the results.
② The system **calculates and presents detailed cost breakdowns**, including direct and indirect expenses.
③ Users can **analyze trends, compare costs across periods, and generate reports** for further review.
Probability of Default (PD) linkage

The function of this screen is to **inquire Probability of Default (PD) data** for corporate customers.
① Users can search for PD values based on various criteria, such as customer ID, rating category, or evaluation date.
② The system retrieves and displays relevant PD information, including historical trends and risk classifications.
③ Users can export the PD data for further analysis or reporting.
This screen helps financial analysts and risk managers **assess credit risk** by providing up-to-date PD metrics, enabling informed decision-making in corporate lending and risk assessment.
Foreign Currency FTP Spreads linkage

The function of this screen is to **retrieve and display Foreign Currency FTP Spreads** for analysis and reference.
① Users can **input search criteria** such as currency type, date range, or specific financial products.
② The system **fetches FTP spread data** based on the entered criteria and presents it in a structured format.
③ Users can **review, compare, and analyze** the displayed FTP spreads to support decision-making.
④ If needed, the data can be **exported or further refined** using additional filters.
Workflow.KinsPageName: FTP Spread Inquiry : 외화 FTP 스프레드를 조회한다

Workflow.WorkStageName:
The function of this screen is to **verify whether a loan spread rate code exists** before registration.
① **Perform an inquiry transaction** to check if the specified loan spread rate code is already in the system.
② If the code exists, review the details before proceeding.
③ If the code does not exist, proceed with the registration process.
Does the **loan interest rate spread code** to be registered exist?

The function of this screen is to **register and manage loan interest rate spread codes**.

① Users can **input, modify, and save** interest rate adjustment codes associated with loan products.
② The system **validates the entered codes** to ensure compliance with predefined rules.
③ Once registered, these codes are **applied to loan calculations**, influencing the final interest rate for corporate or individual borrowers.
④ Users can also **review existing codes** and update them as needed to reflect policy changes.

The function of this screen is to **verify whether the registered or modified items have been applied correctly** through an **inquiry transaction**.
① The user selects the relevant record or criteria for verification.
② The system retrieves and displays the latest status of the registered or modified data.
③ The user reviews the details to confirm successful application.
This screen ensures **data accuracy and consistency** by allowing users to check updates in real time.
Are there any changes to be made?

The function of this screen is to **modify currency-related information** within the system.
① Users can **view and edit** currency details such as exchange rates, currency codes, and applicable regions.
② The system allows **adding new currencies, updating existing records, or deactivating outdated currencies** as needed.
③ Changes made on this screen are **validated and saved** to ensure accuracy and compliance with financial regulations.
④ Once modifications are confirmed, the updated currency information is **applied across relevant banking operations and reports**.
Do you want to delete the additional loan interest spread code?

The function of this screen is to **update the status of the loan spread rate code**.
① **Switch to modify mode** to enable editing.
② **Change the status field** to **"DELETE"** to mark the loan spread rate code for removal.

**Linked Items for Loan Interest Spread Rate / Linked Items:**  
- **Maturity-Linked Spread** (만기대응 스프레드)  
- **Foreign Currency Soundness Surcharge** (외화건전성부담금)  
- **Korea Credit Guarantee Fund Contribution Rate** (신보출연료율)  
- **Activity Cost Upper and Lower Limits** (업무원가상하한)  
- **Disposition Ratio** (처분비중)  
- **Restructuring Ratio** (구조조정비중)  
- **Restructuring Recovery Rate** (구조조정회수율)  
- **Recovery Rate** (회복율)  
- **Strategic Adjustment Spread** (전략조정스프레드)  

These items **are linked and updated whenever there are changes**.

The function of this screen is to **verify the existence of a loan spread** before registration.
① **Perform an inquiry transaction** to check whether the specified loan spread is already registered in the system.
② If the loan spread exists, review the details before proceeding.
③ If the loan spread does not exist, proceed with the registration process.
Does the ** loan interest spread rate** value to be registered exist?

The function of this screen is to **register and manage loan spreads** for credit extensions.
① **Input** the additional interest rate (spread) applied to a base loan rate.
② **Specify** relevant details such as loan type, term, and applicable conditions.
③ **Save** the spread information, making it available for loan pricing calculations.

The function of this screen is to **verify whether registered or modified items have been properly applied** through an **inquiry transaction**.
① Users can enter specific criteria to search for registered or updated records.
② The system retrieves and displays relevant data, allowing users to confirm the accuracy of recent changes.
③ If discrepancies are found, users may need to review or correct the registration or modification process.
Are there any **changes to be made**?

The function of this screen is to **modify loan spread rates** for credit operations.
① Users can **review and adjust** the loan spread applied to specific credit products or customer segments.
② The system allows for **manual input or automated recalculations** based on predefined criteria.
③ Once updated, the modified loan spread is **saved and applied** to relevant loan agreements.
Do you want to **delete loan interest spread rate**?

The function of this screen is to **modify the status of an additional loan interest rate**.
① **Switch to modify mode** to enable editing.
② **Change the status to 'DELETE'** to mark the additional loan interest rate for removal.
